content.title: Financial Assistance (Kanyadaan) on the Occasion of Marriage of Daughter- Haryana Silicosis Board
content.details: The 'Financial Assistance (Kanyadaan) on the Occasion of Marriage of Daughter' scheme is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹51,000/- is provided to workers suffering from silicosis, as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, for the marriage of up to three of their daughters.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹51,000/- is provided to workers suffering from silicosis for the marriage of up to three daughters.
eligibility: The applicant/worker should be employed in a factory or at a construction site.
The worker who is suffering from silicosis as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana can avail the benefits under this scheme for the marriage of their daughter.
The worker should be registered with the Haryana Silicosis Board.
The assistance is available for the marriage of up to three daughters of the worker only.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The applicant may visit the nearest Labour Office and collect the application form. The application process involves filling out the form, attaching necessary documents, and submitting it to the Assistant Director, Industrial Health of the concerned jurisdiction.
documents_required: Medical Report (X-Ray, CT Scan, Medical Prescription, Any Other)
Copy of Aadhaar Card & Voter ID Card
Marriage invitation card attested by Sarpanch/Ward member
Death certificate of the worker if the worker is not alive
Date of birth proof of daughter getting married

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides ₹51,000/- per daughter’s marriage, up to a maximum of three daughters.

faqs.question: What is silicosis?
faqs.answer: Silicosis is an incurable lung disease caused by inhaling silica dust, prevalent in workplaces like stone crushers and mines.

faqs.question: What are the symptoms of silicosis?
faqs.answer: Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, loss of appetite, chest pain, dry cough, respiratory failure, and it can eventually lead to death.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers suffering from silicosis confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, and employed in a factory or construction site.

faqs.question: How many daughters' marriages can be covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance for the marriage of up to three daughters.

faqs.question: How can an eligible applicant apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: The applicant can visit the nearest Antyodaya Kendra or Labour Office and fill up the application form to apply for the benefits.
